column2: MINNESOTA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Minnesota

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 2. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: signal the train to stop.
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 3. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column4: suggested

column2: 4. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: speedgating.

column2: 5. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: exiting a freeway.
column6: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 6. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 7. When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates) a driver should look, listen and slow down.
column4: False

column2: 8. Passing is prohibited:
column4: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 9. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 10. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.
column6: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column8: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column10: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.

column2: 11. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster

column2: 12. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column10: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 13. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: call a taxi if you've been drinking.

column2: 14. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column10: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: No trucks allowed

column2: 16. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column6: the entrance to a construction site.
column8: that you must not drive past this sign.
column10: that you must yield the right-of-way.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop

column2: 18. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 19. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 20. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: soft shoulder

column2: 21. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column8: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.

column2: 22. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 23. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column10: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 24. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 25. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much alcohol you drink.
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 26. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 27. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: No U-Turn

column2: 29. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column4: slow down and drive cautiously.
column8: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.

column2: 30. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column6: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column10: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots

column2: 31. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To halt the traffic flow.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column10: To decrease the state average speed statistic.

column2: 32. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 33. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column6: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 34. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic turn right

column2: 36. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 37. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: green; white

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 39. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column4: solid or broken yellow

column2: 40. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: dangerous intersections.
